detaileddescription.para: Definition representing wait for ever time value for OS API TimeOut
Definition representing wait for ever time value for OS API TimeOut
type definition of wifi event handler

briefdescription.para: type definition for a spawn entry callback

simplesect.para: The function which gets invoked inside stack returns the type short, hence in V1.2.0 simplelink stack this change is required the spawn mechanism enable to run a function on different context. This mechanism allow to transfer the execution context from interrupt context to thread context or changing the context from an unknown user thread to general context. The implementation of the spawn mechanism depends on the user's system requirements and could varies from implementation of serialized execution using single thread to creating thread per call
The stack size of the execution thread must be at least of TBD bytes!

briefdescription.para: Function to De-Initialize the WIFI Driver Layer. disabling WiFi clock , Powering off the WiFi module,Deleting the task and queue created.

simplesect.para: In case of any other error refer BSP_WiFi_CC3100MOD_Connect error codes

briefdescription.para: Function to write given no of bytes over SPI Function to disable the WIFI device.

simplesect.para: any error value refer BSP_WiFi_CC3100MOD_Disable error codes
This function will be called by the WiFi driver API mapped in <user.h> header file

briefdescription.para: Function to enable the WIFI device.

simplesect.para: any error value refer BSP_WiFi_CC3100MOD_Enable error codes
This function will be called by the WiFi driver API mapped in <user.h> header file

briefdescription.para: Function to Initialize the WIFI Driver Layer.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK when successful
RETCODE_OUT_OF_RESOURCES Failed to create Semaphore while calling xSemaphoreCreateBinary.
RETCODE_RTOS_QUEUE_ERROR Failed to create SpawnQAndTask while calling CreateSpawnQAndTask.
In case of any other error refer BSP_WiFi_CC3100MOD_Connect error codes

briefdescription.para: This function call the pEntry callback from a different context.

parameterdescription.para: - pointer to the entry callback
- pointer to any type of memory structure that would be passed to pEntry callback from the execution thread.
- execution flags - reserved for future usage

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - if flags set to SL_SPAWN_FLAG_FROM_SL_IRQ_HANDLER and xQueueSendFromISR is returning pdTRUE
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - if flags set to SL_SPAWN_FLAG_FROM_SL_IRQ_HANDLER and xQueueSendFromISR is returning pdFAIL
WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - if flags set to some value other than SL_SPAWN_FLAG_FROM_SL_IRQ_HANDLER and xQueueSendFromISR is returning pdTRUE
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - if flags set to some value other than SL_SPAWN_FLAG_FROM_SL_IRQ_HANDLER and xQueueSendFromISR is returning pdFAIL

briefdescription.para: This function creates a locking object (mutex semaphore) Locking object are used to protect a resource from mutual accesses of two or more threads.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the locking object control block

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - successfully created lock object
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.

briefdescription.para: This function deletes a locking object.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the locking object control block

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - successfully deleted lock object
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.

briefdescription.para: For details refer API documentation is in the interface header file WlanDriverInterface.h.

detaileddescription.para:
This function locks a locking object All other threads that call this function before this thread calls the WlanDriver_osLockUnlock would be suspended
pLockObj
pointer to the lock object control block
Timeout
numeric value specifies the maximum number of mSec to stay suspended while waiting for the locking object
WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - reception of the locking object within the TimeOut window
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when xSemaphoreTake returns pdFAIL.

briefdescription.para: This function unlock a locking object.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the lock object control block

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - successfully released the lock object
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.

briefdescription.para: This API tries to take the sync object without no wait time.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the sync object control block

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - successful reception of the signal
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.

briefdescription.para: This function creates a sync object (binary semaphore) The sync object is used for synchronization between different thread or ISR and a thread.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the sync object control block

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - successfully created synchronous object
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.

briefdescription.para: This function deletes a sync object (binary semaphore) if the input parameter is valid.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the sync object control block

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - successfully deleted synchronous object
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.

briefdescription.para: This function generates a sync signal for the object (binary semaphore) All suspended threads waiting on this sync object are resumed.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the sync object control block

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - successfully released the synchronous object
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.

This API gives the synchronous object successfully if it was already taken by some one. If the sync object given as input was not taken and this API call simply returns since sync object shall not be given if it is not taken

briefdescription.para: This function waits for a sync signal of the specific sync object.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the sync object control block
numeric value specifies the maximum number of mSec to stay suspended while waiting for the sync signal

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - reception of the signal within the TimeOut window
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.

briefdescription.para: This function generates a sync signal for the object from Interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the sync object control block

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS - successfully released the synchronous object from interrupt
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE - Failure when input parameter is NULL.

briefdescription.para: Function to register the Interrupt handler.

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS when successful
WLANDRIVER_FAILURE when the value of input pointer(pValue) is NULL
This function will be called by the WiFi driver API mapped in <user.h> header file

briefdescription.para: Function to set the current device time.

parameterdescription.para: - pointer to all kinds of useful information about the current time.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK on success, or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: This is the simplelink spawn task required to call SimpleLink Driver's callback from a different context.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the task parameter

briefdescription.para: Function to close the SPI port.

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SPI_ERROR - if spiHandle is NULL
any error value refer #MCU_SPI_Deinitialize error codes
The return type 'int' and input parameter 'Fd_t' cannot be replaced with BCDS datatype since prototype has to match one on one with third party function data type

briefdescription.para: Function to Initialize the SPI port.

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SPI_ERROR - if spiHandle is NULL
WLANDRIVER_SPI_ERROR - if MCU_SPI_Initialize returns some error code other than RETCODE_OK
WLANDRIVER_SUCCESS when successful
The return type 'Fd_t' and input parameters 'char*'and 'unsigned long' cannot be replaced with BCDS datatype since prototype has to match one on one with third party function data type

briefdescription.para: Function to read given number of bytes over SPI.

parameterdescription.para: -file descriptor for spi port, which is not used in current implementation
- pointer to the first location of a buffer that contains enough space for all expected data
len - number of bytes to read from the communication channel

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SPI_RW_ERROR - spi read failed
RETCODE_TIMEOUT - if xSemaphoreTake fails.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
#len - on success returns number of bytes received.
The return type 'int' and input parameters 'Fd_t','unsigned char*'and 'int' cannot be replaced with BCDS datatype since prototype has to match one on one with third party function data type

briefdescription.para: Function to write given no of bytes over SPI.

parameterdescription.para: -file descriptor for spi port, which is not used in current implementation
- pointer to the first location of a buffer that contains the data to send over the communication channel.
len - number of bytes to write to the communication channel

simplesect.para: WLANDRIVER_SPI_RW_ERROR - spi write failed if MCU_SPI_Send returns some value other than RETCODE_OK.
RETCODE_TIMEOUT - if xSemaphoreTake fails.
#len - on success returns number of bytes sent.
The return type 'int' and input parameters 'Fd_t','unsigned char*'and 'int' cannot be replaced with BCDS datatype since prototype has to match one on one with third party function data type
